us.ba3.me

Class MapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • GLSurfaceView
      • us.ba3.me.MapView

  • public class MapView
extends GLSurfaceView
    MapView is the primary way of interfacing with the Altus Mapping Engine. MapView extends GLSurfaceView, therefore, you must call onPause and onResume when your activity or view is paused or resumed. Also, on some devices, when paused / resumed you will need to re-add all maps and set all state as it was because the operating system may have destroyed the original OpenGL context and recreated it. You can extend MapView and override the function onSurfaceCreated if you need to know when this occurs. If you do override this method, call super.onSurfaceCreated prior to adding content to the map view so that it can create the necessary native objects behind the scenes.

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG

        public static boolean DEBUG
        Controls display of OpenGL debug messages. The default is false. Set prior to creating instances of MapView.

      • PRESERVE_GLCONTEXT_ONPAUSE

        public static boolean PRESERVE_GLCONTEXT_ONPAUSE
        Controls whether or not the mapping engine asks the operating system to preserve its OpenGL context when paused. The default is true. Set prior to creating instances of MapView

      • CACHESIZE

        public static int CACHESIZE
        Initial size of cache used for map assets. The initial default is 90MB. Set to lower / higher before creating instances of MapView

      • TILESINFLIGHT

        public static int TILESINFLIGHT
        Controls the number of parallel requests the engine will make for raster, terrain, or vector tile data. The default is 2. Set before creating instances of MapView

      • CALL_EGL_DESTROYCONTEXT

        public static boolean CALL_EGL_DESTROYCONTEXT
        Controls how the MapView's EGL factory responds to destroyContext requests from the operating system. If set to true, we will destroy the context as requested, but this causes a SEG_FAULT on Nexus 7 2012 models. If set to false, we will ignore the request. In either case, we will assume our OpenGL context is not longer valid and we will delete all of our native objects and threads.

      • setMaxTileRenderSize

        public void setMaxTileRenderSize(int tileSize)
        Sets the maximum tile size on screen. This minimum tile size on screen is half of the max.
        Parameters:
        tileSize - size in dp. Default is 380.

      • setTileLevelBias

        public void setTileLevelBias(float bias)
        The tile level bias helps balance between a uniform level of tiles on screen vs maintaining the max tile specified by setMaxTileRenderSize. A bias of 1 will attempt to move tiles up to one level towards the most common level for a particular view. In general this increases the number of tiles visible and memory usage for a tile map by a significant amount at small scales (when the view is zoomed out a significant ammount). With a bias of 0, traditional tiled raster maps with varied content per level can look odd at small scales because at one one view tiles of several different levels may be visible.
        Parameters:
        bias - Default is 1

      • setPanVelocityScale

        public void setPanVelocityScale(float panVelocityScale)
        Scales pan velocity at small scales. At large scales panning locks to geographic position of finger location
        Parameters:
        panVelocityScale - Default is 1

      • setTerrainColorBar

        public void setTerrainColorBar(ColorBar colorBar,
                      int waterColor)
        This color bar affects the color of all terrain maps. It is recommended you remove and add existing terrain maps and clearing the cache for that map when changing this property otherwise terrain tiles already cached will not reflect the new color bar.
        Parameters:
        colorBar - a map of height values to color values
        waterColor - the color for all water in the terrain map

      • addMap

        public void addMap(java.lang.String mapName,
          java.lang.String mapSqliteFileName,
          java.lang.String mapDataFileName,
          boolean compressTextures)
        Add a map layer to the current view. The map must have been a map produced by the BA3 metool.
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the map for this view.
        mapSqliteFileName - The fully qualifed path/filename of the map's .sqlite file.
        mapDataFileName - The fully qualified path/filename of the map's .map data file.
        compressTextures - Whether or not raster data from the map should be compressed to 2-byte format internally.

      • addVectorMap

        public void addVectorMap(java.lang.String mapName,
                java.lang.String mapSqliteFileName,
                java.lang.String mapDataFileName)
        Add a vector map layer to the current view. The map must have been a map produced by the BA3 metool.
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the map for this view.
        mapSqliteFileName - The fully qualified path/filename of the map's .sqlite file.
        mapDataFileName - The fully qualified path/filename of the map's .map data file.

      • addMBTilesMap

        public void addMBTilesMap(java.lang.String mapName,
                 java.lang.String fileName,
                 java.lang.String defaultTileName,
                 ImageDataType imageDataType,
                 boolean compressTextures,
                 int zOrder,
                 MapLoadingStrategy mapLoadingStrategy)
        Adds an MBTiles raster map. Generally, these maps are produced with TileMill from MapBox. The map is added using an internal native tile provider path. Map bounds and maximum zoom level are read from the MBTiles database. Internally, the mapping engine will use a completely native tile provider to load tiles from the MBTiles database and no extra image memory copies are ever created. This is the fastest way possible to load an MBTiles map using the mapping engine.
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the map layer
        fileName - Fully qualified path to the mbtiles filename
        defaultTileName - The name of a cached image to use if waiting for tiles to load.
        imageDataType - Indicates whether the raster tiles are JPG or PNG
        compressTextures - YES to compress tile textures to a 2 byte format
        zOrder - Layer order for this map
        mapLoadingStrategy - Controls how tiles get loaded, kLowestDetailFirst will load tiles top down (less efficient but better user experience, kHighestDetailOnly will load only tiles at the current zoom level, faster)

      • addInternetMap

        public void addInternetMap(java.lang.String mapName,
                  java.lang.String urlTemplate,
                  java.lang.String subDomains,
                  int maxLevel,
                  int zOrder,
                  int numWorkers,
                  boolean useCache,
                  boolean enableAlpha)
        Add a map layer that is composed of spherical mercator projected tiles available on a web server. Map tiles will be downloaded and saved to the application cache directory/mapName as individual files. Under the hood, the mapping engine is creating a virtual map layer, and using an instance of us.ba3.me.virtualmaps.TileFactory as the TileProvider for the virtual map. The TileFactory will use up to numWorkers TileDownlaoder tile workers. This simple approach will work with internet-based maps from a variety of map sources.
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the map for this view.
        urlTemplate - A URL template that will be used to construct final URLs for image downloading. For example: http://{s}.tiles.mapbox.com/v3/dxjacob.ho6k3ag9/{z}/{x}/{y}.jpg Where {s} will be the subdomain (i.e. a, b, c, or d, etc.) and {z}, {x}, and {y} will be replaced with spherical mercator tile tree numbers respectively.
        subDomains - A comma separate list of sub-domains (i.e. "a,b,c,d")
        zOrder - Layer order for the map
        numWorkers - the number of parallel workers to create (don't make this high, try 3 or so)
        useCache - If true try reading from the cache, if false, ignore the cache.
        enableAlpha - If true, the map is comprised of tiles that may not be fully opaque (like a weather overlay)

      • addMapUsingMapInfo

        public void addMapUsingMapInfo(MapInfo mapInfo)
        Adds a map layer whose type and properties are specified by a MapInfo object.
        Parameters:
        mapInfo - An MapInfo object or MapInfo derived object that specifies the map type and properties.

      • removeMap

        public void removeMap(java.lang.String mapName,
             boolean clearCache)
        Remove a map layer from the current view and optionally clear the internal caches. If caches are not cleared, and you re-enable the same map at a future point, cached data 'may' be used to draw the map. If you choose to clear the cache, the engine will re-request all map data if you later re-add that map. Whether or not you want to flush the cache depends on your scenario. For example, if your application has downloaded an updated map, you would want to remove the existing one and clear its data from the cache. If the user is just toggling a map on and off, you would not want to clear it data from the cache the cache.
        Parameters:
        mapName - The name of the map file (or layer name).
        clearCache - A boolean value that indicates whether or not to flush the map's data from the cache.

      • removeAllMaps

        public void removeAllMaps(boolean clearCache)
        Removes all maps currently displayed and optionally flushes the cache.
        Parameters:
        clearCache - True to clear cache.

        public void vectorTileLoadComplete(TileProviderRequest request,
                          GeometryGroup geometryGroup)
        Called after a TileProvider tile request to add a tile to the mapView
        Parameters:
        request - must be an object from a previous TileProvider requestTile method call
        geometry - polygons and lines for the tiles

                         DynamicMarker dynamicMarker)
        Add a dynamic marker to a dynamic marker map.
        Parameters:

        dynamicMarker - Object that fully describes the dynamic marker. Either uiImage or cachedImageName MUST be set.

      • setDynamicMarkerAnchorPoint

        public void setDynamicMarkerAnchorPoint(java.lang.String mapName,
                               java.lang.String markerName,
                               PointF anchorPoint)
        Set a dynamic marker anchor point
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the dynamic marker map layer.
        markerName - Unique name of the marker to be updated.
        anchorPoint - center of rotation in the marker image in pixels. An anchor point of (0,0) would rotate around the bottom left of the image

      • setDynamicMarkerOffset

        public void setDynamicMarkerOffset(java.lang.String mapName,
                          java.lang.String markerName,
                          PointF offset)
        Set a dynamic marker offset
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the dynamic marker map layer.
        markerName - Unique name of the marker to be updated.
        offset - offset in pixels to be applied after rotation. If the rotation is 0, and offset of (10,10) is equivalent to an anchor point of (10,10).

      • setDynamicMarkerLocation

        public void setDynamicMarkerLocation(java.lang.String mapName,
                            java.lang.String markerName,
                            Location location,
                            double animationDuration)
        Set a dynamic marker location.
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the dynamic marker map layer.
        markerName - Unique name of the marker to be updated.
        location - New location for the marker.
        animationDuration - Amount of time to animate marker to new location.

      • setDynamicMarkerRotation

                            java.lang.String markerName,
                            double rotation,
                            double animationDuration)

        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the dynamic marker map layer.
        markerName - Unique name of the marker to be updated.
        rotation - New rotation for the marker.
        animationDuration - Amount of time to animate marker to new location.

        polygonId - An identifier for the polygon which will be returned if polygon hit testing is enabled.

      • setTrackUp

        public void setTrackUp(boolean trackUpEnabled)
        Enables or disables the map view to take into account the view heading. If disabled, the current heading is maintained but map view is displayed as if N is always pointed towards the top of the screen.
        Parameters:
        trackUpEnabled -
